intro: Gnaphalium valparadiseum, commonly known as the Valparaíso feathergrass, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has slender, wiry stems covered in fine, white hairs. Its small, yellowish flowers are borne in dense clusters, and the plant is often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It is noted for its ability to thrive in harsh, coastal environments and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
